lines.text: Vengeance blackens the soul, Bruce. I've always feared that you would become that which you fought against. You walk the edge of that abyss every night, but you haven't fallen in and I thank heaven for that.
[Alfred sees Batman in costume for the first time]
My... God!
[At Bruce's parents' grave]

It doesn't mean I don't care anymore. I don't want to let you down, honest, but... but it just doesn't hurt so bad anymore. You can understand that, can't you? Look, I can give money to the city - they can hire more cops. Let someone else take the risk, but it's different now!
[thunder and lightning]
Please! I need it to be different now. I know I made a promise, but I didn't see this coming. I didn't count on being happy.
[thunder and lightning]
Please! Tell me that it's okay.

[enters]
Maybe they already have. Maybe they sent me.
[They embrace in the rain]

[when Batman picks up the phone in Andrea's apartment]
Hello, anybody home? Listen, boopsie, even though you never call and never write, I still got a soft spot for you. So I'm sending you a fun gift, airmail! And there's no use jumping out the window this time, toots...
[Batman looks out the window and sees a toy Joker plane flying in carrying a bomb]
The plane of the future is going to make you history!
[Batman throws a Batarang, exploding the bomb outside the window; the blast knocks him back against the wall, and the phone is left dangling]

[laughing]
Hello? Hello, operator? I believe my party's been... disconnected! HA-HA-HA-HA-HAAAAA!
Your father's dead, isn't he? You came into town early to get Chuckie Sol, so you could shift the blame to your father if necessary.
They took everything, Bruce. My father, my friends, my life, you. I'm not saying it's right, or even sane but it's all I have left! So either help me, or get out of the way!
You know I can't do that.
Look what they did to us! What we could have had! They had to pay!
But Andy... what will vengeance solve?
If anyone knows the answer to that, Bruce, it's you.
[silent pause]
Leave, Andy, now. Please.
Mi casa nostra es su casa nostra.
[Andrea Beaumont has just called Arthur's office]
Now ain't that a co-inky-dink?
[grabs Arthur by his shirt]
Here we are discussing the old man when the spawn of his loins just happens to call! Makes you want to laugh, doesn't it, Artie?
[he laughs maniacally]
[the Phantasm goes to Valestra's mansion, but instead finds Valestra dead, along with Joker's surveillance camera and a bomb]

Whoops! Ha! I guess the joke's on me. You're not Batman after all. Looks like there's a new face in Gotham and soon his name will be all over town... to say nothing of his legs, and feet, and spleen, and head...
[the Phantasm leaps out the window just as the bomb explodes]
You think you know everything about me, don't you?
I diapered your bottom; I bloody well ought to, *sir*!
Stay away! This is not your fight!
This madness ends now!
All right, I give in. I surrendered already. Tell her, Batman.

[Panting]
Andrea, you've got to... get out of here! The whole place is set to... explode!
No. One way or another it ends tonight. Goodbye, my love.
[Sal walks through the remains of the "Future of Gotham" park as the robots sing; then the Joker enters]
I hate that song... Gasp! Can it be? Old Sallie "the Wheezer" Valestra! Welcome, paisan! It's been a dog's age!

[nervously]
Hello, Joker. Didn't mean to drop by unannounced.
So, what's an old-timer like you want with a two-timer like me?
Can't be too careful with all those weirdos around.
You're not smiling, Joker. I thought you found death amusing.
Oh, me? You won't hear a giggle out of me.
[Joker presses a button. Hazel the Robot laughs maniacally and attacks with a cleaver]
[while Reeves is trying to resist the effects of Joker's toxin, Batman appears in his hospital room]

[gasps, then giggles helplessly]
Oh, no!
Why did the Joker meet with you?
[Reaves keeps giggling]
It has to do with the gangster murders, doesn't it? He thinks you're involved. WHY?

[giggling]
I don't know!

[grabs him]
That's not the answer I want!
[Reaves manages to calm down]
Beaumont needed me to help him and his kid get out of town...
[starts to giggle again]
He kept in touch.
When was the last time you spoke to him?
Years ago, my first election campaign. I was running out of money and I asked him for help...
[giggles]
He said no!
So you sold him to the mob.

[now laughing hysterically]
I was broke! Desperate! They said all they wanted was their money back!
[he collapses with laughter, as Batman leaves in disgust]
Don't touch me, old man! I don't know where you've been.

[on TV]
What kind of city are we running when we depend on the support of a potential madman!
[click]
What rot, sir! Why you're the very model of sanity. Oh by the way, I pressed your tights and put away your exploding gas balls.
Thank you, Alfred.
Ain't it always the way? You get in the mood and company shows up.
I'm impressed, lady. You're harder to kill than a cockroach on steroids.
So, you figured it out.
[the Phantasm removes his mask to reveal Andrea Beaumont]
Gotta hand it to you, nice scheme. Costume's a bit theatrical, but hey, who am I to talk?
What's that you're practicing?
Jujitsu.
Gesundheit... That was a joke.
Do you still follow your dad's orders?
The way I see it, the only one in this room controlled by his parents is you.
[last lines]
Quite a sight.

[Melancholic]
Yes.
I'm sorry. Do - Do you want to be alone?
I am.
You're crazy! I'm your only chance to get out of here! Let me go or we'll both die!
Whatever it takes!
The city councilman and his wacky pal!
[at Andrea's mother's grave]
So, tell me - with all that money and power, how come you always look like you want to jump off a cliff?
Why do you care?
I don't. Mom was asking.
Hi. Hey, what happened to you? Trip over some loose cash? It's been three days since we met and still no calls. I figured you must be dead or something.
You expect every guy you meet to call you up?
The ones who are smart enough to dial a phone.
There are certain advantages to having a sturdy cranium, Master Bruce. But then, hardheadedness was always your virtue.
Sal Valestra, your Angel of Death awaits...
For once, I'm stuck without a punchline.
Very cute! But I can blow smoke too, toots!

[just before dropping a statue on Buzz Bronski]
You always were a loser, Mr. Bronski.
[Buzz talks to Chuckie's tombstone, leaving a wreath]
Chuckie, Chuckie. You always were a loser.
You just don't know when to quit, do you?
That's it. That's what I want to see, a nice big smile.
[Bruce's crime-fighting training is derailed by his infatuation with Andrea]
What am I doing, Alfred? This isn't part of the Plan! I must be going nuts!
If I may be so bold, sir, I'd say quite the opposite.
What do you want?
[the Phantasm points his right arm at Chuckie]
I want you, Chuckie boy.
He didn't do it! It's garbage, Councilman! The Batman does not kill. You want him, you get him! I'll have no part in it.
Hello, Joker. Didn't mean to drop by unannounced.
[Bruce proposes to Andrea]
I never thought this would happen. I always felt like... like I'd thrown you a curveball, like you never knew what to do with me, because I wasn't in "The Plan".
You are now. I'm changing the Plan.
[after meeting Sal Valestra]
Is my shirt too big, or is that my flesh crawling?
Tsk, tsk. And to think those tax money would pay these jerks.
You!
That's right, Artie. Bring in the press, why don't you. What a photo op! The councilman and his wacky pal.
You're no friend of mine.
Oh, Artie, I'm crushed! How and ho the mighty forget. Don't you remember? You, me, Sally and the gang?
What are you talking about? I never met them or you. I work for Beaumont. I didn't know what he was doing.
But you knew it afterwards and put it to good use, eh?
What do you want?
To find out who's iced the old gang.
Haven't you read the papers? It's Batman.

[pressing his joy buzzer]
Wrong. It ain't the bat. Nope, nope, nope. I've seen the guy. He looks more like the Ghost of Christmas Future. Nowhere near as cute as Batboy.
You're saying it was someone else?
Yeah, someone wouldn't mind seeing our old pals out of the way.
